intro: Ononis zschackei, commonly known as the narrow-leaved bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters. The plant features slender, branched stems and small, opposite, narrow leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are pale yellow and appear in clusters, blooming from late spring to early summer. Ononis zschackei is often found in grassy areas, along roadsides, and in disturbed soils, where it thrives in full sun to partial shade.
